== Main Inclusion Report for pngquant ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/p/pngquant/]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** New build dependency of Tomboy; running this on the PNG images in the documentation helps to produce a 5mb space saving
0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=pngquant|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search?search=pngquant&x=0&y=0|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: none
** Does not run as root, no daemons
** No network activity
** Processes PNG images to quantize and dither them
** Shallow source code review performed; code seems clean and well commented
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package does not require configuration
** Package does not ask any debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:pngquant|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: none filed currently
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/p/pngquant.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is calm
** <nowiki>[[http://www.libpng.org/pub/png/apps/pngquant.html|Upstream]]</nowiki> is calm
** Couldn't locate upstream bug tracker
** Does not deal with hardware
** No test suite
0. ''UI standards:''
** User-visible strings are internationalized using standard gettext system ? No
** Package with translatable strings builds a PO template during package build ? N/A
** End-user applications ship a desktop file ? N/A
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliance? Yes
** Packaged with CDBS, very simple rules file, no patches
0. ''Dependencies:''
** libpng, zlib
** Both in main already
0. ''Maintenance:''
** How much maintenance is this package likely to need ? Package is very stable and calm, not likely to need much/any attention from Ubuntu; sync should take care of everything
** Who is responsible for monitoring the quality of this package and fixing its bugs?  Debian maintainers/upstream
0. ''Background information:''
** What do upstream call this software ?  Has it had different names in the past ? pngquant, not as far as I can tell
0. ''Internationalization:''
** Are graphical applications translatable? Do they support gettext? N/A
